message: Congressman Ralph Norman will be hosting an open house at the District flagship office in Rock Hill!  The reception will take place in the lobby of The Business Technology Center. Tours of the office will be available.  Light refreshments will be provided.  Hope to see you there!
NA

This past Monday I had the honor and the privilege of being sworn in to represent the 5th District of South Carolina in Washington. I am humbled and thankful for all your support, and most of all the trust you put in me to help lead our great country. Now, the hard work of governing begins and I am eager to work hard moving our district, our state, and our nation in a positive direction!
NA
NA
NA
Time to get to work.

What a whirlwind of a week! After being sworn in as a Member of Congress on Monday, I’ve been busy learning the ropes, and setting up the D.C. and District Offices. I’m proud to say that this week the House passed 2 important pieces of legislation that will combat illegal immigration:  H.R. 3003 - No Sanctuary for Criminals Act: Clarifies ICE detainer authority by establishing probable cause standards to issue detainers for the first time. Withholds federal grant dollars from cities/jurisdictions that violate federal law (i.e. if officers are prohibited from communicating with ICE). Allows victims of crime to sue cities/municipalities that refuse to comply. Contains Sarah and Grant’s Law – ensuring illegal aliens convicted drunk driving are detained.  H.R. 3004 - Kate’s Law: Amends section 276 of the Immigration and Nationality Act relating to reentry of removed aliens. This law enhances penalties for deported felons who return to the US.
NA
Kershaw County Sheriff Jim Matthews is a man of character who is unafraid to take a stand and do the right thing. We are fortunate to have him as a law enforcement leader.

Proud to have Casual Cushion of Rock Hill in D.C. as a part of President Trump's Made in America Showcase this week. Our friend and Director Mick Mulvaney and I had the honor of welcoming the Siesel's to the White House!
Thanks to South Carolina's Titan Farms for sending peaches to the SC Delegation. Looking forward to sharing this taste of home with my D.C. colleagues. There's nothing like a South Carolina peach!

My Republican colleagues and I campaigned on a promise to fix our broken healthcare system and to repeal Obamacare. Yesterday, I signed a discharge petition, which would force a clean Obamacare repeal bill to be brought to the House floor for a vote. It’s time for Congressional Republicans to keep our promises to the American people – they deserve nothing less.

Last night, the House unanimously passed the #ForeverGIBill which will improve and extend the education benefits granted to veterans. With this important legislation, veterans will be able to use their GI Bill education benefits all throughout their lives!   I will continue to support our nation's veterans and all the brave servicemen and women.
One Month Ago I Swore The Oath Of Office...

Had the special privilege of meeting and praying with All For One Ministries in front of the Capitol! They traveled from Lancaster, Great Falls, Chester, and Rock Hill for a mission trip dedicated to sharing the Lord's message.

#DidYouKnow that House Republicans and I are committed to economic growth, patient-centered health care, rebuilding our military, peace of mind for families, and fixing Washington? Take a look at what we have done so far: https://www.didyouknow.gop/

#Obamacare is spiraling out of control and it is simply not sustainable. For years, House Republicans and Senate GOP have promised Americans to #repealandreplace Obamacare. With President Trump's encouragement and a Republican controlled Congress, the House followed through on that promise by passing a bill that did just that. I am extremely disappointed in the Senate’s failure to come together and deliver on the promises we made. We cannot give up on fixing this nation’s broken healthcare system. My colleagues and I will continue to fight until we get this job done.

Extremely excited to welcome Samsung to Newberry! This new manufacturing plant will bring close to 1,000 jobs to the people of Newberry County! #MadeInTheUSA #MadeInNewberry  http://www.newberryobserver.com/opinion/columns/17574/big-things-happening-in-newberry
Had a great time this morning meeting and talking with constituents at The Corner Cafe in #Gaffney! Thank you to everyone who came.

Wow! What an informative plant tour today of Freightliner Custom Chassis Corporation. Located in Gaffney, this motor frame producer provides chassis to RVs, school buses and large company trucks. All #MadeInAmerica.  FCCC also is an employer of 650 South Carolinans. #MadeInGaffney
SAVE THE DATE: I hope you can join me at Ebenezer Grill in Rock Hill tomorrow morning at 8 A.M. for #CoffeeWithTheCongressman!

Busy day today in #RockHill!   I appreciate the time constituents took out of their morning to come meet me and express their thoughts during #CoffeeWithTheCongressman at Ebenezer Grill!  Followed by two facility tours at #ComerDistributing and #CompositeResource. Both are prime examples of why the manufacturing and distributing industries have such a positive impact on the economy and job creation in South Carolina.

Great op-ed by House Republicans Chair Congresswoman Cathy McMorris Rodgers explaining what the House is doing to make Americans' lives better. I encourage you to read it.  http://dailysignal.com/2017/08/02/5-ways-house-working-improve-americans-lives/

Join me for breakfast and coffee tomorrow morning in #UnionCounty! I am holding two #CoffeeWithTheCongressman events so that I can have the opportunity to listen to your concerns. Hope to see you there!
Watch a recap of my visit to the Composite Resources facility from the Rock Hill Herald!  http://www.heraldonline.com/news/local/article165030382.html
Started today off by having coffee and breakfast with residents of #SunCity at Cruzen Reubenz!

Happy to have been able to visit Wireless Medics - Indian Land, Burns Ford  in #Lancaster and Lancaster Motor Company!   As a business man myself, I am keenly aware of how important local businesses are for South Carolina's 5th District. I will continue to be a strong supporter of legislation that will help small businesses grow.

Thank you Lancaster Rotary Club for allowing me to speak today and share with you what the media does not... House Republicans are keeping our promises and we remain focused on the issues that mean the most to you.

I had the privilege to eat lunch today with veterans at Midway BBQ in #UnionCounty. It is critical that Congress honors the promises made to those who have made great sacrifices to defend our great nation.   I will continue to be supportive of efforts made to better assist our veterans.
My statement on #VCSummer:
Don't forget: it's sales #taxfree weekend in South Carolina!   http://www.wltx.com/news/local/the-sales-tax-holiday-runs-all-this-weekend/461778384

Yesterday, I spent the day meeting with constituents in #UnionCounty!   Here is a recap of my visit from the The Union Times: http://www.uniondailytimes.com/features/lifestyle/12467/norman-supports-immigration-reform
Join me for coffee! I look forward to listening to you about what issues matter the most to you.

Talk about living the American Dream! Today I visited All Pro Solutions, Inc. in #RockHill where I met owner Tibi Czentye. He shared with me his inspiring story!  In 1991, Tibi and his family left Romania and came to America through all the proper legal channels. Because of his strong work ethic and dedication, Tibi overcame many hardships before fulfilling his dream of owning his own business.   His family's journey to becoming legal citizens of the United States of America is a great reminder that we are a nation of immigrants but also a nation formed on the rule of law.
Thank you so much to the residents of Westminster Towers for allowing me to visit today!
Don't forget to join me tomorrow morning for another "Coffee With Your Congressman"!
It was wonderful to meet so many constituents this morning at #CoffeeWithYourCongressman in Richburg!
‪Met with a group of veterans today in Chester, SC. Thank you for your dedicated service and the great sacrifices you made to defend our nation‬!
Toured the Giti Tire plant located in Chester County this afternoon. As the first North American manufacturing site for Giti Tires, this plant is expected  to create 1,700 jobs for South Carolinians!

Thanks to the efforts of  President Donald J. Trump and House Republicans, the NFIB finds that #smallbusiness optimism has picked up momentum!  http://www.nfib.com/surveys/small-business-economic-trends/

#DidYouKnow that the United States has the world's highest corporate tax rate?!   House Republicans and I are committed to #taxreform so that U.S. businesses can have a better opportunity to compete globally and be able to provide and keep quality jobs here.

The evil that was displayed yesterday in Charlottesville cannot be tolerated or condoned by the American people and has no place in our great country. We are all Americans that must unite against this type of bigotry and hatred.

I met with the Army Reserve in York, SC today where I was able to learn more about the assistance they provide to our U.S. Army. As a strong supporter of our nation's military and veterans, I was honored to talk with them. And I am forever grateful for their dedicated service to this country.

Thank you Shutterfly for allowing my staff and I to tour your manufacturing facility in Fort Mill, SC. I remain committed to work hard in Washington, D.C. to find ways to help businesses expand so they can provide more quality jobs for South Carolinians.

Toured the Haile Gold Mine yesterday in Kershaw. They employ over 560 South Carolinians and are committed to being involved in the local community.    While I am in Washington, I will do whatever I can to ensure that businesses are able to expand and continue to provide quality jobs.

Thank you DaVita Dialysis Center in Fort Mill for allowing me to tour your facility and listen to local healthcare professionals and patients on how to improve our failing healthcare system.  #Obamacare is spiraling out of control and it is simply not sustainable. The American people want a change. We cannot give up on fixing this nation’s broken healthcare system. I will continue to fight until we get this job done. Action must be taken. Doing nothing is not an option.

Today is the #SolarEclipse! Here are some great things for South Carolinians to know in order to enjoy this spectacular event safely and well prepared:  http://www.thestate.com/news/local/article168300382.html

Last week I had the great opportunity to tour Shaw Air Force Base and witness a F-16 demonstration.   I am proud to have voted in favor of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year of 2018. This bill adds thousands of additional military personnel, enhances our military's readiness, and provides our service members with the biggest pay raise in eight years.

During my tour of Fort Mill's BLACK+DECKER Distribution Center, I was given the opportunity to build a DEWALT drill. The best part about it was when I put a #MadeInTheUSA sticker on it!  President Donald J. Trump, House Republicans and I are committed to fixing our broken tax code. We need tax policies that will encourage investment, hiring, and growth. That means more jobs here at home! Look forward to seeing more #MadeInTheUSA stickers.
My Rock Hill office will be changing location on August 31st. Location and contact information are listed below:

I fully support President Donald J. Trump's strategy for gaining stability in #Afghanistan and keeping America safe. Our enemies should never know our strategic plans. Conditions on the ground and expertise of our military leaders must determine our defense strategy, not arbitrary and public deadlines. General Mattis and our military leaders have my full confidence in their capability of implementing a smart and effective plan to win in Afghanistan. The President’s plan will ensure that terrorists will never use Afghanistan as a haven to attack United States soil again.

Yesterday, President Donald J. Trump signed another pro-veterans bill into law: the Veterans Appeals Improvement and Modernization Act.   The VA's current appeals process is broken, and the backlog of appeals is out of control. #Veterans who experience a disability as a result of their service deserve to have their appeals decided in a timely manner.  This new system will help the VA move through the backlog of appeals so veterans waiting on their disability decision can have peace of mind. An important step toward ensuring our veterans have the care they deserve!
Had a great time speaking with and listening to #veterans from Kershaw County! Thank you to all veterans for the sacrifices made.

Today, I was disappointed to hear Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen’s statement downplaying the harmful effects of #DoddFrank Act regulations on mortgage lending and small business lending.   As a member of the House Small Business Committee and a small businessman myself, I recognize how the Dodd-Frank Act has hindered the ability of small businesses and middle class American families to access many financial products. Dodd-Frank has impeded the ability of our community banks and credit unions to provide lower and middle class Americans the assistance they need to buy homes and build their businesses.   The Financial CHOICE Act, passed by the House of Representatives earlier this year, takes critical steps towards easing these burdens on lenders and getting real Americans the support they need to pursue the American Dream.  https://youtu.be/5r2L4HeiS0Q

Our deepest prayers and thoughts are with all those affected by #HurricaneHarvey. Thank you to all the brave first responders! #PrayForTexas  Here is a link for you to connect with voluntary organizations in order to help the victims: https://www.nvoad.org/
When helping hurricane #Harvey victims, beware of any #charityscam looking to steal your money or info. www.irs.gov/eoselectcheck

President Donald J. Trump's remarks on #taxreform today were spot on. Our tax code is way too complicated! We need a simple and fair code that is pro-growth, pro-jobs, pro-family and pro-American. Great to see that the President is eager to work with Congress on a plan that will create more jobs and let Americans take home more of their hard-earned money.

I have introduced an amendment to #HR3354- the Make America Secure and Prosperous Appropriations Act, which the House will vote on later this week, to cut EPA funding  to the levels requested by President Donald J. Trump's Office of Management and Budget request.   Read my op-ed published today here: http://dailysignal.com/2017/09/06/congress-follow-trumps-lead-cut-epa-funding/

Governor Henry McMaster has declared a state of emergency before #HurricaneIrma's arrival. South Carolinians, please take this time to review safety plans so that you can be prepared should they be needed.  http://myfox8.com/2017/09/06/sc-gov-mcmaster-declares-state-of-emergency-ahead-of-irmas-arrival/

As #HurricaneIrma approaches, please take a look at South Carolina Emergency Management Division's emergency kit check list so you can plan ahead and be prepared: http://www.scemd.org/planandprepare/preparedness/emergencykit

Thank you President Donald J. Trump for approving Governor Henry McMaster's Emergency Declaration request for the state of South Carolina as #HurricaneIrma approaches.   This approval will provide assistance for all 46 counties and the Catawba Indian Nation and authorizes FEMA to provide emergency protective measures.

Today I testified in front of the US International Trade Commission. I spoke how I firmly believe that the government should only intervene in the market when there is a clear benefit to the American consumer. I am proud to be a strong advocate for the free market system and for competition which creates quality jobs all around the 5th district. Look forward to seeing more jobs here in the U.S. and promoting more free trade.  I spearheaded a bi-partisan letter with my colleagues to the ITC that protects competition in the washer industry and protects Americans consumers and workers.   View the letter here: https://norman.house.gov/sites/norman.house.gov/files/ITC%20201%20Letter%20-%20Final.pdf
A pro-growth tax code will increase jobs in our communities, grow wages, and put more money back in your pocket. Here’s how:

Yesterday, I was proud to have joined 89 other conservatives in Congress to oppose H.R. 601 which packaged together aid for #HurricaneHarvey, and a debt ceiling limit suspension, federal flood insurance extension, and a CR to fund the federal government for the next three months.   Congress once again has chosen to take an easier road of delay and postponement and procrastination over biting the bullet and dealing with the tough issues upfront and forthright. Tactics like this are why federal spending continues to rise and why we find our country with a $20 trillion debt.  I support hurricane relief.  In fact, early in the week, I proudly joined the bi-partisan effort in the House (the bill passed 419 to 3) that would have provided the folks in Texas and Louisiana $7.9 billion in immediate assistance.  Those folks are suffering and need our help.  But they were used as pawns in a sick political game, and they were held hostage by a political argument over the debt ceiling. They deserved better.

SCHOOL CLOSINGS & DELAYS: Ahead of #HurricaneIrma's arrival, please be aware that some South Carolina school districts have announced closures and delays.   Be sure to see if your school district has announced any closures or delays.

Sixteen years ago, the United States of America was placed under attack at the hands of vicious and cowardly terrorists. Nearly 3,000 innocent people lost their lives.   On this day, we remember the many loved ones that were taken by the purely evil acts aimed at destroying this country. We honor all the brave first responders. And we continue to show immense gratitude for all servicemen and women who have sacrificed their lives in order for the United States to remain the land of the free.   We must all stand together and do whatever can be done to prevent another horrific tragedy like 9/11 from ever happening on American soil again. This tragic event is all the more reason to keep our military strong and well-funded, which I will always do while serving the 5th District of South Carolina.  #NeverForget
House Republicans vision for #taxreform → simple, competitive, and most of all AFFORDABLE.   Learn more about our plan here: https://fairandsimple.gop/?utm_source=Rep+Ralph+Norman
My staff and I were honored to help the USO put together care packages today for service members assisting with hurricane relief efforts in Texas and Florida! #BeTheForce

Last week, I inquired about the Dislocated Workers National Reserve to ensure it was fully funded in light of the  worker layoffs at the V.C. Summer facility. Getting people that have been laid off from their jobs back to work, as quickly as possible, is critically important for our communities and economy.

I joined  Shannon Bream on Fox News this morning and expressed how important it is for Congress to support President Donald J. Trump's tax agenda and move forward with a fair and simple #taxreform for the American people.

Today, I voted in favor to pass the Make America Secure and Prosperous Appropriations Act of 2018. For the first time since 2009, the House has passed all 12 appropriations bills on time. This legislation appropriately funds the government and contains numerous conservative victories that promote the House Republicans agenda.  American safety was the top priority of this bill. We have included pro-life protections, provided funding to strengthen our military so we can defeat ISIS, protected the Second Amendment, increased our border security, invested into our infrastructure and allocated money for important medical research.  This bill also fully funds Displaced Workers Assistance National Reserve, a program which can aid those affected by the #VCSummer facility layoffs. (see video of my remarks below)  I am happy to see that my amendment to this bill passed so that more money can be given to combat the opioid epidemic that is sweeping this nation.  I thank the Appropriations Committee for all the hard work they have done with this bill so that we were able to get this job done on time.

You deserve to keep more of your hard-earned paychecks!  House Republicans and I are working hard to ensure that we take advantage of this once in a lifetime opportunity to fix our broken tax system. It has been over 30 years since the last #taxreform!  The time is now to pass a comprehensive and pro-growth tax reform so that the tax system is fairer, simpler and less burdensome for the American people!
Happy 70th Birthday to the United States Air Force! Thank you for your dedicated service! #AFBday

Today, I met with Lancaster County Administrator Steve Willis and the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service to view the Gills Creek work site. Great to see the federal government and local government come together in a fiscally responsible manner and help solve the flooding problem that was burdening so many residents in the area!
Can you believe it has been over 30 years since we have passed a #taxreform?!   Here are #31ReasonsForTaxReform--> tinyurl.com/y8c2znoo
Very pleased with President Donald J. Trump's speech to the UN today. We must keep a strong national defense and put America first! #UNGA

Thank you #UnionCountyRotaryClub for allowing me to come speak with you and provide an update of what is happening in Washington, D.C.  We must take advantage of this opportunity to pass a pro-growth #taxreform! It has been over 30 years since the last reform...: https://tinyurl.com/y8c2znoo

The government has no business in picking winners and losers...  Read my op-ed in the Washington Examiner: http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/heres-how-trade-protectionism-can-destroy-american-manufacturing-jobs/article/2635278

This garden dedicated to veterans is a wonderful way to honor and remember all the sacrifices made by our brave and dedicated servicemen and women.  http://www.heraldonline.com/news/local/article174887266.html

It was great to see State Representative Todd Atwater - SC House 87, my good friend and former colleague in the South Carolina State House, and his wife Beth in Washington, D.C. today! Thank you for stopping by.

Today, I stood with members of the Republican Study Committee  as we remain committed to keep the promises made to the American people to repeal Obamacare, #taxreform, and secure the border. #RepealReformSecure
Had a great time last night joining my colleagues in the #CongressionalCharityBasketballGame! Thank you to everyone who came out to watch the game and support the local youth.

Today, President Donald J. Trump and  House Republicans released the rollout of framework for #taxreform.  It has been over 30 years since the last tax reform and it has resulted in a diminishing American middle class and a rise in income inequality.  This framework will make our tax code simple, fair, and easy for Americans to understand. American workers will be able to keep more of their hard-earned paychecks. America will be able to compete globally and create more Americans jobs.  Click below to learn more about how this will provide tax relief for the American middle class and businesses:

The American flag and National Anthem is a reminder to us all of the brave men and women who have paid the ultimate price in protecting this great nation and our very way of life; and must always be honored.  http://www.breitbart.com/big-government/2017/09/28/rep-norman-nfl-underestimating-fans-say-player-protests/

Today, America welcomed back Majority Whip Congressman Steve Scalise to the people's House. I have only been in Congress for two months, but, what transpired on the House floor was something truly inspiring and something I have never experienced before.  During a time when a lot of debate can leave us divided, members from across the aisle displayed a genuine sense of unity.  It is my sincere hope that Congress will continue to come and work together in the months ahead.  Please take the time to listen to Whip Scalise's return to the House floor.
Great to see the South Carolina National Guard, especially guardsmen from our district, going to Puerto Rico to lend a helping hand in a desperate time of need. #HurricaneMaria
My thoughts and prayers are with all those affected by the tragedy in Las Vegas. Thank you to the brave first responders.

Had the great privilege to visit the Lockheed Martin's Fighter Demo Center today and learn about the amazing capabilities of the F-35 provided to our nation's military.   The F-35 suppliers located in South Carolina have a great economic impact and provide quality jobs for South Carolinians.

ICYMI: This morning I talked about the #LasVegas tragedy, response to #PuertoRico and the House Republicans' #taxreform plan.  https://soundcloud.com/breitbart/breitbart-news-daily-rep-ralph-norman-october-3-2017

Since the passage of Roe v. Wade in 1973, nearly 60 million abortions have been performed. This is a moral atrocity. I am a proud cosponsor of H.R. 36, the Pain Capable Unborn Child Protection Act, which will make it illegal to attempt or to perform an abortion if an unborn child is 20 weeks or older with exceptions.  Science has proven that babies are capable of feeling pain at the start of the third trimester. It is imperative we protect the lives of the unborn.  Our nation was built upon the idea of ‘life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.’ We guarantee that every American citizen has the right to pursue absolute happiness. Our Constitution guarantees that every American has the right to liberty and justice. Should we not then absolutely guarantee that every American has the right to life as well?  I am very encouraged to see H.R. 36 pass today. We are one step closer to protecting the sanctity of life for all Americans. #TheyFeelPain

The topic of today's House Committee on Science, Space, and Technology hearing was resiliency of our electric grid.  It is imperative that we work to promote policies and technology that improves electric grid resiliency while also protecting consumer rights’ to privacy.
Our national debt is an astronomical $20 trillion! Time to take our debt seriously. It’s possible to reign in our out-of-control spending.   Here’s how-->  https://tinyurl.com/ycunmwz6 #RSCBudget

Our national debt now sits at over an astronomical $20 trillion and is projected to reach close to $30 trillion within ten years. I am pleased that the House passed a #budget that will provide the spending cuts that Washington needs and a pathway to reconciliation to for #taxreform.  Washington’s out-of-control spending hinders our economy. By kicking the can down the road, it puts the financial burden on the backs of our children and grandchildren.  This budget will reduce spending by $5.4 trillion over a 10- year window. It does not expand the size of federal government. It does not encroach on state or local authority. This is a conservative path forward and will help us accomplish what we came here to do: tax reform.  While l would like to see our government make even more wise choices with taxpayer dollars, this budget resolution puts us on the road to achieving that goal. With this resolution as the vehicle for updating our outdated tax code, we can accomplish something that hasn’t been done in over 30 years.
President Donald J. Trump declared today, October 6, #NationalManufacturingDay.  Manufacturers in #SC05 and across the U.S. drive innovation, create jobs and make America strong.  Happy #MFGDay17!
This great read in the The Wall Street Journal shows how the House Republicans #taxreform plan is pro-growth. The time is now to get this job done!

I support disaster relief efforts for the people afflicted by the recent natural disasters in our country. However, leaving the taxpayer on the hook for $16 billion without structural reform to the National Flood Insurance Program is irresponsible. Tying  this reckless measure to disaster relief for American citizens is callous and cruel.

ICYMI: I joined Neil Cavuto on FOXBusiness to talk about the House Republicans #taxreform plan.  Not having comprehensive tax reform in 31 years is unacceptable! Our tax system is broken. Hard-working Americans deserve a tax system that works for them.

Join me tonight for the #Gaffney District Office Open House! Hope to see you there.
This morning I joined Fox Business's Varney & Co. to talk about the #taxreform plan. The time is now for a fair and simple tax code!
Come join me tomorrow morning at The Peach Stand, Fort Mill, SC for "Coffee with Your Congressman"! Look forward to meeting and listening to you.
Had the opportunity to participate in a F-16 familiarization flight at Shaw Air Force Base today.  Thank you to all our U.S. military members for their dedicated service to this nation.
Had a great time talking and listening to many of you at The Peach Stand, Fort Mill, SC this morning for "Coffee With Your Congressman"!  http://www.heraldonline.com/news/local/article179542501.html

Our tax code in America is broken. It’s been 31 years since any major overhaul. We need to ensure that paying taxes is simpler, easier and less time-consuming.  Imagine a new way to file your taxes... the House Republicans #taxreform plan allows taxpayers to file on nothing more complicated than a postcard!

#ObamaCare was sold on false promises that could never be kept. Recall what they told us in order to sell this bill: If you like your health care plan, you can keep it; if you like your doctors, you can keep them; premiums will go down – and for families they’ll go down by an average of $2,500; deductibles will go down; emergency room visits will go down.  Op-ed in Fox News with Rep. Mark Meadows here: http://www.foxnews.com/opinion/2017/10/19/gop-reps-democrats-outrage-over-trump-sabotage-obamacare-is-misdirected.html

Yesterday, I testified before the US International Trade Commission (ITC) regarding a Section 201 “safeguards” case. In the case, Whirlpool alleges Samsung and LG have caused injury to domestic markets by importing high volumes of large residential washers and their parts. Whirlpool is seeking heavily restrictive tariffs and limitations on their own competition.   The government shouldn’t jump into markets to restrict competition. This is a textbook example of the government’s ability to pick winners and losers and why they shouldn’t be able to do so.   This could have a large impact on the developing Newberry Samsung facility, which is set to create nearly 1000 new jobs in South Carolina’s 5th district. Samsung has already demonstrated investment in the state by making large investments in the Charleston Fisher House, an organization supporting veterans and their families in our state.  Read my testimony: https://norman.house.gov/UploadedFiles/rep_norman_remedy_testimony_final_draft.pdf
SAVE THE DATE: Please join me for an open house of my #RockHill District Office on Monday, October 30th from 5pm-7pm.  Hope to see you there!

7 days to go...!  Calling all #SC05 tech-savvy students! My office is now accepting submissions for The Congressional App Challenge Find out more here: norman.house.gov/constituent-services/congressional-app-challenge.htm

Today, I voted to pass the FY 2018 #Budget Resolution. This is a critical first step to achieving comprehensive #taxreform and making the American economy great again.   Our nation has not significantly reformed our tax code in more than three decades, allowing the tax code to explode in complexity and unnecessarily burden hardworking American families and businesses.  The unified framework unveiled earlier this year will simplify the tax code for everyone, eliminate wasteful tax loopholes, and reduce taxes on businesses.Under this plan, the average family will see an increase in income between $4,000 and $9,000 annually.  While I believe that this budget is necessary to spur economic growth and increase wages, I am disappointed that the Senate removed the $203 billion of mandatory spending cuts given the challenge the national debt poses to the United States.   However, we should not make the perfect the enemy of the good, and I understand that issues as complex as the budget and tax reform require compromise.

Was happy to join S.E. Cupp last night on HLN to talk about the House Republicans #taxreform plan.  After 31 years of no comprehensive tax reform, the time is now to give the American people a simple and fair tax system that works for them. It is what they deserve!

Thank you #Newberry Mayor Foster Senn for reinforcing the importance of trade to domestic industry, specifically in the 5th District.  https://www.fitsnews.com/2017/10/27/foster-senn-no-ralph-norman-wasnt-duped-on-trade-issue/
Do you support or oppose a #taxreform plan that simplifies the tax code, reduces rates for businesses & families, and lowers taxes for job creators?

Today, I joined a bipartisan group of 38 other members to send the Committee on Ways and Means a letter urging for the reauthorization of GSP.  It is my sincerest hope that Chairman Brady and Ranking Member Neal make the reauthorization of GSP a priority. As a member of the House Small Business Committee and a small businessman myself, I understand just how important GSP is for a level playing field for companies to compete and the creation of jobs here at home. Thank you to everyone who came out to the #RockHill District Office Open House last night! I had an awesome time meeting and talking with you all.  There was even a special appearance from a Ghost Buster!

Tonight was a win for South Carolina peanut farmers! The House passed the South Carolina Peanut Parity Act of 2017, which I co-sponsored.   South Carolina has experienced explosive growth in peanut farming in recent years, going from producing very few peanuts in the early 2000's to becoming the fourth largest peanut producing state today.   This legislation will finally give South Carolina peanut farmers the much deserved representation on the Peanuts Standard Board.

As we celebrate National #Veterans Small Business Week, I want to honor all the veteran entrepreneurship across the 5th District and nation. There are over 50,000 veterans and close to 50 veteran-owned small business in the 5th District alone. These businesses greatly impact the economic growth of our communities and create many jobs for South Carolinians.  I am forever grateful to these veteran small business owners for their service to this country. Empowering small businesses and our nation’s veterans will continue to be priorities of mine that I will strongly fight for in Washington. #MyVetBiz  Learn more about veteran entrepreneurship here: https://tinyurl.com/y7gpqshg

I am disappointed that my amendment to fully #repeal #Obamacare didn’t get a vote. Since I just got elected in June, I have not had the opportunity to vote on a repeal. I attached this amendment to a bill that repeals only a very small portion of the Affordable Care Act because I saw this as an opportunity to keep my word to my constituents and deliver on fully repealing Obamacare.  Congress cannot forget our promises to the American people. We have to find a way how to get this done. There are enough smart people in the room for us to come up with the plan to fully repeal and replace Obamacare.

Historic day today! House Republicans introduced bill for comprehensive #taxreform that is pro-family, pro-growth and pro-American. This hasn't happened in 31 years! Americans deserve a fair and simple tax code that works for them, not against them. This plan is pro-family, pro-growth and pro-American. It will benefit the middle class, allow for hard-working Americans to keep more of their paychecks, and for businesses to compete and grow to expand jobs. We will make the American economy great again! Learn more here: www.fairandsimple.gop

Just introduced my first bill, the Better Evaluation of Science and Technology (BEST) Act, with Rep. Paul Gosar. This bill will no longer allow Federal agencies to make rules behind closed doors.   If we are a government of the people, we need to be as transparent as possible so that we’re also a government for the people.

It may be cliché to say that “small and local businesses are the backbone of our economy” but at the end of the day, there is no denying that statement. Small businesses truly are the gears that keep our economy moving, and when they suffer, our economy suffers.  Since 2015, when the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) adopted an expanded definition of the “joint employer” standard – upending decades of precedent and redefining who an employer is – there has been much confusion and ambiguity. For example, since then, there have been over 65,000 letters sent to Congress expressing confusion and asking for clarity in the aftermath of this rule.  Locally owned franchises are America’s unseen small businesses, and in my district alone, there are roughly 2,000 establishments that provide over 15,000 jobs with an economic output of over 1 billion dollars. #Smallbusiness development, economic growth, and entrepreneurs will continue to be hurt by the NLRB’s excessively broad definition of “joint-employer” until Congress finds a concrete definition – which this piece of legislation will do.   The Save Local Business Act provides clarity for small and local businesses as to what it means to be a “joint employer,” restoring necessary clarity for employers and employees alike. I am proud to have voted for this bipartisan bill which helps small businesses all across the nation.

Proud to have voted to pass the National Defense Authorization Act. Our military deserves our fullest support to ensure that they are adequately equipped with the resources and tools to maintain American readiness, and to keep Americans safe at home and abroad. This bill does just that.  Not only does the #FY18NDAA increase the size of our military so we can best prepare and provide much-needed and updated equipment, it also gives our troops the largest pay raise in eight years. Our servicemen and women, who make sacrifices for us every day, deserve this pay raise. We enjoy the freedoms we have today, and continue to have, because of our men and women in uniform.

Yesterday, Congressman Francis Rooney and I introduced the Pell for Performance Act.   The taxpayer-friendly Pell for Performance Act will encourage students who receive the Pell Grant - a federally funded grant program - to graduate college in a timely manner. Currently, the government provides over $30 billion a year in Pell Grant aid, and 46% of students who attend college receive the Pell Grant. In fact, nearly 40% of all students do not graduate on time.   This legislation will ultimately save taxpayer dollars by holding Pell Grant recipients accountable for not graduating on time, rather than leaving the taxpayer to foot the bill.

#TaxReform is good for the taxpayer, not the tax collector. Today, the House passed the #TaxCutsAndJobsAct. A historic victory for middle-class families and small businesses in the 5th District of South Carolina. It is no secret that our tax code is broken. For the first time in 31 years, we passed a bill that overhauls our complex tax code. We will deliver more jobs, a fairer and simpler tax code, and bigger paychecks for American workers.  Our plan is pro-growth and pro-family. Under this legislation, South Carolina will see an additional 13,850 jobs created. Hard-working middle-class families in South Carolina will see an income increase of $2,391. We have increased the Child Tax Credit from $1,000 per child to $1,600 to help parents with the cost of raising children. The inclusion of an immediate expensing of capital investment will allow a farmer to purchase a tractor to expand operations or allow a mechanic to add a new bay to the shop.  I look forward to President Donald J. Trump signing a tax reform bill into law. Let’s work together to create jobs, increase paychecks, grow our economy, and improve lives.

In the 5th District of South Carolina, and across the nation as a whole, the solar industry is a major leader in creating economic growth and providing quality jobs.  The proposed tariffs would affect the entire industry and could have devastating effects on the solar industry as a whole and American families. It is predicted that these trade protections could cost South Carolina alone 7,000 jobs, with a nationwide impact of 88,000.  It is my hope that Ambassador Lightizer and the Trump Administration heavily consider what the proposed trade remedies could have on solar employers and workers nationwide. We need to focus on strengthening American competitiveness, increasing investments, and not risk tens of thousands of Americans their jobs.  View the entire letter I headed to Ambassador Lightizer here: https://norman.house.gov/uploadedfiles/solar_itc_remedy_letter.pdf

The Federal Communications Commission has voted to adopt the Restoring Internet Freedom Order. I applaud the leadership of Chairman Ajit Pai, who has led this effort in an open and transparent fashion. For the first time in FCC history, the text of an order was made available to the public for three weeks before the vote. This has resulted in the most well informed record ever compiled on #netneutrality.   The Internet was free and open before the heavy-handed Title II Internet regulations placed in 2015 by the Obama Administration, and it will be free and open after they are repealed.

In South Carolina's 5th District, the median household income is $48,243. Under this #taxreform bill, these families- the true middle class- will receive a tax CUT of $1,331. That is 3% of their yearly earnings.   With this cut, these families will keep an extra $102 a month in their pockets. This gives the opportunity to: put away towards savings, pay off debts, have more family outings, purchase more school supplies and clothes for the kids, an extra night for a babysitter, etc. Ultimately, this tax cut let's YOU decide how to spend YOUR money.   Don't be fooled when some say this tax cut is not for the average middle class family.
